comments.html:
There is one more important drawback to this dynamic solution:
The infected PC would probably ask the firewall to allow all IPs on all ports. No, I don't want that.
comments.name: KarstenI

comments.html: If you trust the host to be able to decide its own security policy, then the only firewall policy you need is "if dst.ip == X then allow". The only thing a more granular firewall policy would give you is to drop rejected packets one or two hops sooner :)
comments.name: Sander Steffann

comments.html: Service mesh can be an interesting option here - where each application announces its service(s) to the service registry, with corresponding ACLs. That removes the gap between applications & firewall owners, and it simplifies the cleanup process (which rarely happens in many enterprises).
comments.name: Frederic
